RECORD:
Rare disease patients have complex clinical representations. Patients with Epileptic Encephalopathy, Early Infantile, 68 present clinical features that include seizures, intellectual disability, and movement disorders. This phenotype is associated with a variety of mutations in the gene encoding the synaptic scaffolding protein SHANK3.

The disease is caused by a mutation in the SHANK3 gene. The SHANK3 gene is located on the short arm of chromosome 22 (22q. Some special cases also present with microcephaly, seizures, and mental retardation.

The diagnosis of this disease is based on clinical findings, genetic testing, and imaging studies.

There is no cure for this disease. Treatment is symptomatic and supportive.

This disease is caused by mutations in the SHANK3 gene. The SHANK3 gene is located on the short arm of chromosome 22 (22q.
